reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were bought a "winter indulgence" 2 day break by our daughter and this proved to be a truly great experience. We had two nights dinner, bed and breakfast, afternoon tea, vineyard tour and free bottle of "champagne".
reviews.title: A wonderful all round experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 8 hotel rooms are in a low building which looks quite ordinary, but inside they are very well furnished, spacious and with a terrace overlooking the vines. The separate bathroom was also well-sized with fresh towels each day. The bed was large and comfortable and the room was well equipped with TV/DVD, tea, coffee, biscuits etc. There is however no wi-fi. Afternoon tea was one of the better ones we have experienced, lovely light scones, cake and sandwiches, but surprisingly no choice of tea offered other than English breakfast. The restaurant was first class with plenty of choice. Lots of fresh local produce, well presented and cooked. The venison and beef are both recommended. Not quite Michelin standard, but not far off. The vineyard's own wines were delicious and not much more expensive than in their on-site shop. You need to like white wines though. There are other wines available, but we wanted to sample the Three Choirs. Breakfast was also excellent, good quality full English with especially fine bacon.
reviews.title: Stunning Views, Excellent Room, Great resturant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful and the lady who gave the vineyard tour was particularly interesting and good humoured. This was a highlight for me with several samples to taste on offer. I have visited vineyards in France, Spain, Chile and Argentina and this was one of the most interesting tours. The vineyard is immaculately maintained in a perfect English setting and provides a delightful country walk.
reviews.title: The Three Choirs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a lovely break, thanks to our daughter, but would certainly be happy to pay for ourselves and enjoy a relaxing and indulgent stay on another occasion.
reviews.title: A relaxed Sunday lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now I have your attention, I have to say I had a great two days!.
reviews.title: Fabulous relaxing weekend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here in July after she sponsored a vine for me as a birthday gift. We found the rooms spacious and well-appointed; the king-size bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was large with an excellent shower and plenty of lovely cosmetic products, there were two comfy arm-chairs and the secluded terrace with its table and chairs looked out onto the acres of vines.
reviews.title: Terrific rooms, peaceful location, quality food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was plentiful and very filling and the excellent restaurant served terrific food.
reviews.title: Great as a gift for a quiet retreat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a super place to spend a relaxing couple of days in the sun, although I'm not sure how much fun it would have been in the good-old English rain...
reviews.title: Loved every minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Treated my Dad for his retirement to a weekend at Three Choirs. This review is on their behalf. Rooms in the standard rooms were very roomy with views over the vines. On a sunny day the location would be out of this world to sit out on the patio looking out over the rows and rows of ripe grapes. The pickers were harvesting the grapes whilst they were there and they enjoyed watching them from their room.
reviews.title: An oasis in a vineyard !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked them into the restaurant for an evening meal. The food was fantastic, but very very expensive (so ideal as a treat only!!). Portion sizes small, but this is what you expect for fine dining.
reviews.title: Amazing start to our honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knowing how much we love our vino our daughter treated us to an afternoon's wine tour, tasting and afternoon tea at Three Choirs.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Obviously hoping we were going to be able to actually drink at the tasting and not just sniff the boquet and swill the wine around we booked ourselves in for a one night stay and booked a table in the restaurant for dinner.
reviews.title: Good location, room & food, but ouch! - expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved it and hope to make a return visit during the winter as we noticed a lovely fireplace in the restaurant!
reviews.title: Wonderful Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can imagine the vineyard is beautiful at any time of the year but we were fortunate to be able to enjoy the fabulous views from our room on a gorgeous sunny afternoon and early evening.
reviews.title: room with a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff very welcoming and helpful allowing us to use the value of our afternoon tea against the dinner instead. Afternoon tea would have been bit too close to dinner so we made the request and there was no fuss.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and unwind, superb food, wine not bad too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had meal and overnight stay including very enjoyable wine tour. All very satisfactory apart from a few details that felt like we were " inconveniences" - for example we arrived early and while accepting that the bedroom was not ready we were told it was not possible to sit in the lounge during lunch time ! It wasn't even busy but even if it was this was hardly a welcome ! At breakfast I asked for the wi fi connection as I use iPad for my daily newspaper (I pay a subscription) and was told that guests were not permitted access to the Internet. If the 3 choirs is to be a complete and enjoyable experience these kind of details are very important.
reviews.title: Almost great !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well maybe everyone else already knows the quality of the wine they produce at this place but we were very pleasantly surprised and have already re-ordered a case. We stayed in a lodge room which was quiet and comfortable, though the bath took a bit of skill to get in and out - high and narrow. It was a bit of a walk away from the main building which was no problem for us as the weather was fantastic and a stroll though the vines was a great start and end to dinner but might not be so much fun in the rain. We had breakfast delivered in a hamper which we ate on our own terrace. Dinner was terrific. We didn't try the wine-tasting as we have seen enough wineries but everyone coming away from it looked happy. Not a conventional hotel but our stay was just lovely -perfect way to relax.
reviews.title: Peace, quiet, good food and surprisingly good wine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took advantage of the 2 night wine tasting break which included dinner (3 courses and a bottle of Three Choirs wine) bed and breakfast together with a bottle of sparkling wine upon arrival - booked as a birthday treat for my partner.
reviews.title: Perfect stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found all staff really helpful; in the restaurant, the shop, and the wine-tasting tour. The lady checking us in in the shop was really helpful and friendly too (maybe the other reviewers got her on a bad day).
reviews.title: Dissapointing Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was stunning with artwork of the vineyard and beautiful black Chinese furniture, a very comfy king-size (or larger) bed with French windows opening out to the lovely views of the vineyard - you could be in the south of France! We found the room spotlessly clean (room 8) although there was a little bit of peeling paint in the bathroom (due to the steam from the shower) that could do with a touch up.
reviews.title: A relaxing, tranquil break in the heart of the English Countryside
